intro: Astragalus pseudorigidulus, commonly known as the rigid milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Mongolia, and Russia. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, compound leaves, and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus pseudorigidulus is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
